meanings.definition: Lacking interest or excitement; dull and uninteresting.
meanings.sent1: The lecture was as dryasdust as watching paint dry.
meanings.sent2: The dryasdust textbook made it hard to stay awake in class.
meanings.sent3: The dryasdust meeting felt like a never-ending snooze fest.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was so dryasdust, it was like listening to a monotone robot.
meanings.sent5: The dryasdust movie had everyone yawning within minutes.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is boring or unexciting.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the dryasdust of the group, always putting people to sleep with his stories.
meanings.sent2: The book club decided to skip discussing the dryasdust novel.
meanings.sent3: The party was a total dryasdust with no music or dancing.
meanings.sent4: The museum exhibit was a dryasdust, lifeless collection of artifacts.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's jokes fell flat, leaving the audience feeling dryasdust.
